column4: does anyone know what would keep changing my dns servers address?
well, probly the dhcp server, for some strange reason, hands you a different DNS server each time - odd, but not illegal
it is an old DNS, from a previous wireless connection that i was on, the current wireless i am on's dns server keeps gettin overwritten
do you think your connection is dropping out & keeps swapping between APs ?
once DHCP has brought up the link, the dns won't change
when you bring up dhcp, it will write the dns server to /etc/resolv.conf - if this file keeps changing, it's because your dhcp client keeps reconnecting
okay, then how come dhcp keeps gettin an old wireless dns server, that i am completely out of range from

I imagine that the old /etc/resolv.conf has the old wifi setting - when the dhcp client brings the connection up, it overwrites /etc/resolv.conf - then the connection drops out, and the old /etc/resolv.conf is moved back into place
i have resolve.conf and resolve.conf~ , would do you mean that it is using the second one to rpleace the first one?
not sure - can't test dhcp from here - I'm wondering if resolv.conf~ is just a leftover editor temp file?
if it was, what would that mean?
it would mean it's storing the old resolv.conf somewhere else, for instance, pppd uses /etc/resolv.conf.pppd-backup
so I think your wireless is dropping out - I'd be looking for radio strength & checking /var/log/messages for reconnects
